Gentlemen:
In light of several conversations and communi¬
cations of recent date concerning the search for a new
Executive Director, I should like to summarize our position
at this time and ask for guidance frcci this group.
IN REFERENCE TO EARL WYNN - All of the responses
which we have had concerning him, with one exception, hav<
been highly complimentary and most favorable every
member of the above group has indicated belief that Wynn
is our best candidate and that we shou34jnake him an offer
of this job. The one negative comment([considered by the
person who received it confidentially-A
!8
not of sufficient
importance to make him change his mind. This negative
comment raised the question of Earl’s organizational ability.
I had one confidential letter from a man who has worked
with him ever since he went to North Carolina saying that
several years ago Earl had one unpleasant staff situation
arise, but felt that that was a valuable lesson for Wynn
and that he was a better man as a result of it. ^11 of
the communications have indicated that Wynn is doing a
spectacular job at North Carolina and that North Carolina
can ill afford to lose him - and that leads to iry second
point concerning him. Vtynn is still interested in the
NAEB proposal, but I gather that there is less certainty
that he will accept our proposal than there was at the
time when we first approached him.
This further obviates the urgency of a meeting
with Earl prior to the Minneapolis meeting and points up
a second fact. We must continue to trace references on
other people and look for new possibilities in the event
Wynn does not accept our offer.
Allen raised the subject of Tom Rishworth as a
possible candidate in a recent communication with me, and
